question: James Duckworth, who won the men’s singles title at the Bengaluru Open ATP Tennis Challenger, belongs to which country?
explanation:
The $1,62,000 Bengaluru Open ATP Tennis Challenger tournament recently concluded. Australia’s James Duckworth won the men’s singles title, which is also his fifth ATP Challenger Tour title in last 12 months. He had earlier reached the semi-finals at the Tata Maharashtra Open.
India’s Ramkumar Ramanathan & Purav Raja duo won the men’s doubles title by beating Leander Paes and Matthew Ebden 6-0, 6-3 in the final.  The veteran Indian player Leander Paes bid farewell to Tennis as this was his last ATP event match.
